title: Canyonlands National Park: Basic Information
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information             Basic Information           Physical Address           Island in the Sky - 33 miles from Moab on UT 313 The Needles - 77 miles from Moab on UT 211 The Maze - 205 miles from Moab off UT 24 - unpaved roads  Moab, UT 84532                 Directions         To reach the Island in the Sky, take US 191 to UT 313 - 10 miles north of Moab - and then drive southwest 22 miles. To reach The Needles, on US 191, drive 40 miles south of Moab, then take UT 211 roughly 35 miles west. Getting to the Maze requires four-wheel-drive and more time. To reach Hans Flat Ranger Station, From I-70, take UT 24 south for 24 miles. A left turn just beyond the turnoff to Goblin Valley State Park will take you along a two-wheel-drive road, 46 miles to the ranger station.  Directions Details           Operating Hours & Seasons         Open Year round Canyonlands National Park is open 24 hours a day, year round.   Standard Hours    Sunday: Open 24 hours   Monday: Open 24 hours   Tuesday: Open 24 hours   Wednesday: Open 24 hours   Thursday: Open 24 hours   Friday: Open 24 hours   Saturday: Open 24 hours             Weather           Canyonlands is part of the Colorado Plateau, a "high desert" region that experiences wide temperature fluctuations, sometimes over 40 degrees in a single day. The temperate (and most popular) seasons are spring (April-May) and fall (mid-September-October), when daytime highs average 60 to 80 F and lows average 30 to 50 F. Summer temperatures often exceed 100 F, making strenuous exercise difficult. Winters are cold, with highs averaging 30 to 50 F, and lows averaging 0 to 20 F.          Fees & Passes     Entrance Fees:   Private Vehicle - $25.00 Valid for 7 days. Admits one (1) private, non-commercial vehicle (15 passenger capacity or less) and all its occupants.   Motorcycle - $15.00 Valid for 7 days. Admits one (1) individual on a private, non-commercial motorcycle. Any passengers pay the per-person fee not to exceed the private vehicle fee.   Per Person - $10.00 Valid for 7 days. Admits one (1) individual with no car. Typically used for bicyclists, hikers, and pedestrians. Youth 15 and under are admitted free.   Entrance Passes:   Southeast Utah Parks Annual Pass - $50.00 Valid for one year through the month of purchase. Admits one (1) private, non-commercial vehicle or its pass holder to Arches and Canyonlands national parks, and Hovenweep and Natural Bridges national monuments.         Visitor Centers       Needles Visitor Center The visitor center is open daily, spring through fall. Features include: exhibits, book and map sales, backcountry permits, general information, picnic area, and park rangers on duty. Water is available year-round. Orientation Movie, "Wilderness of Rock" (15 minutes) is shown on request at the visitor center.   Island in the Sky Visitor Center The visitor center is open daily, spring through fall. Features include: exhibits, book and map sales, backcountry permits, general information, and park rangers on duty. Drinking water is available outside the visitor center spring through fall. A 15-minute orientation movie, "Wilderness of Rock," is shown on request at the visitor center. Vault toilets are available at the visitor center.   Hans Flat Ranger Station The remote Hans Flat (Maze) Ranger Station is open daily year-round. There is a small sales area with books and maps. There are no services, food, gas, or potable water sources in the Maze district. These are located in Hanksville (68 miles), or Green River (86 miles).                Hikers at the Needles        There are no roads within the park that cross the Green or Colorado rivers and directly link any of Canyonlands' districts. Though they may appear close on a map, traveling between districts requires two to six hours by car. Most people find it impractical to visit more than one or two districts in a single trip. Permits & Reservations Make reservations for backcountry and river trips, or get a permit for other special uses.    Weather Weather here can change quickly; prepare for a wide range of conditions.    Pets Where can I take my pet?   Goods & Services  Canyonlands is an isolated and rugged environment. You won't find many services here; it's best to bring what you'll need for your visit.
